verses.text: Observe the month of Abib, and keep the passover unto the \sc Lord\sc* thy God: for in the month of Abib the \sc Lord\sc* thy God brought thee forth out of Egypt by night.
Thou shalt therefore sacrifice the passover unto the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, \add of\add* the flock and the herd, in the place which the \sc Lord\sc* shall choose to place his name there.

Thou shalt eat no leavened bread with it; seven days shalt thou eat unleavened bread therewith, \add even\add* the bread of affliction; for thou camest forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that thou mayest remember the day when thou camest forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of thy life.

And there shall be no leavened bread seen with thee in all thy coast seven days; neither shall there \add any thing\add* of the flesh, which thou sacrificedst the first day at even, remain all night until the morning.
Thou mayest not sacrifice the passover within any of thy gates, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee:

but at the place which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God shall choose to place his name \add in\add*, there thou shalt sacrifice the passover at even, at the going down of the sun, \add at\add* the season that thou camest forth out of Egypt.
And thou shalt roast and eat \add it\add* in the place which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God shall choose: and thou shalt turn in the morning, and go unto thy tents.
Six days thou shalt eat unleavened bread: and on the seventh day \add shall be\add* a solemn assembly to the \sc Lord\sc* thy God: thou shalt do no work \add therein\add*.
Seven weeks shalt thou number unto thee: begin to number the seven weeks from \add such time as thou\add* beginnest \add to put\add* the sickle to the corn.

And thou shalt keep the feast of weeks unto the \sc Lord\sc* thy God \add with\add* a tribute of a freewill offering of thine hand, which thou shalt give \add unto the \+sc Lord\+sc* thy God\add*, according as the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath blessed thee:

and thou shalt rejoice before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite that \add is\add* within thy gates, and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that \add are\add* among you, in the place which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hath chosen to place his name there.
And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt: and thou shalt observe and do these statutes.
Thou shalt observe the feast of tabernacles seven days, after that thou hast gathered in thy corn and thy wine:

and thou shalt rejoice in thy feast, thou, and thy son, and thy daughter, and thy manservant, and thy maidservant, and the Levite, the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, that \add are\add* within thy gates.

Seven days shalt thou keep a solemn feast unto the \sc Lord\sc* thy God in the place which the \sc Lord\sc* shall choose: because the \sc Lord\sc* thy God shall bless thee in all thy increase, and in all the works of thine hands, therefore thou shalt surely rejoice.

Three times in a year shall all thy males appear before the \sc Lord\sc* thy God in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and they shall not appear before the \sc Lord\sc* empty:
every man \add shall give\add* as he is able, according to the blessing of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God which he hath given thee.
Judges and officers shalt thou make thee in all thy gates, which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee, throughout thy tribes: and they shall judge the people \add with\add* just judgment.
Thou shalt not wrest judgment; thou shalt not respect persons, neither take a gift: for a gift doth blind the eyes of the wise, and pervert the words of the righteous.
That which is altogether just shalt thou follow, that thou mayest live, and inherit the land which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God giveth thee.
Thou shalt not plant thee a grove \add of\add* any trees near unto the altar of the \sc Lord\sc* thy God, which thou shalt make thee.
Neither shalt thou set thee up \add any\add* image; which the \sc Lord\sc* thy God hateth.
